{"step_by_step_thinking": "Influenza is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses. The secondary attack rate of influenza is indeed between 5-15%, so option A is true. Option B is also true, as the virus can be shed before the patient presents with symptoms, which is why it can spread so easily. Aquatic birds are a known reservoir for influenza viruses, so option D is also true. However, children aged 1-5 years are considered a high-risk group for influenza, especially for severe illness and complications. Therefore, option C is not true.", "answer_choice": "C"}
